p: Arkhipova and coworkers [ 63] employed tetraethylammonium bis (trifluoromethylsulfonyl)imide, [N 2222][NTf 2], to study the redox properties of mesoporous graphene nanoflakes, showing a capacitance above 100 F/g, while M. Pajaket al. [ 64], have demonstrated that some protic ammonium based ILs with nitrate anion (ethylammonium nitrate and propylammonium nitrate) can act as proton donors in the electrosorption of H 2 in palladium. This result is quite relevant because most of the “first generation” ionic liquids were discarded over the years.
